Basic tools like a sturdy shovel, warm clothes, and maybe a snow blower will do. A snow blower can be a good investment if you plan to help a lot of people. It makes the job faster and easier, which means you can help more customers. 2. Sell printables on Etsy Selling printables on Etsy is a great way to make extra money during the winter. Printables are digital files that buyers can download and print at home. This side hustle is perfect if you want to work from home and set your own hours. You can design things like planners, calendars, art prints, or even holiday-themed items. If you enjoy being creative, this could be a perfect fit for you. You don’t need a lot of experience to get started. There are many online tutorials to help you learn how to design and list your printables. Selling printables allows you to earn passive income. Once you upload your designs, they can be sold over and over without any extra work. It’s a great way to make money while you sleep! You can learn more at How I Make Money Selling Printables On Etsy. 3. Selling handmade crafts Winter is a great time to make and sell handmade crafts. You can also make holiday ornaments and decorations. If you enjoy making crafts, you can sell them online. Websites like Etsy make it easy to reach buyers. Another option is to showcase your products at local holiday markets in a booth. These events are popular in winter. 4. As a freelance writer, you can write many things. This includes blog posts, articles, and even short stories. You get paid by the word or by the project. I have been a freelance writer for years, and I love how flexible this side hustle is. You can take on as many or as few writing projects as you’d like, which can be great if you are looking for a way to make extra income only in the winter. 6. Pet owners will pay you to make sure their pets are happy and safe. There are apps like Rover that can help you get started. These apps let you find pet sitting gigs easily. You just create a profile, and people can hire you. Or, you can even put up flyers on a local bulletin board (such as at a grocery store or community center near you). 7.
